messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 145
messages.msgSnippet: ... i know the feeling!  i recently joined a couple more lists with the volume across all of them combined, i m really starting to get myself confused.  but
messages.messageBody:
> From: Lborowiec@...
>
> Hi! I've been lurking for several weeks now. Receiving all these
> messages is new to me, and a bit difficult to keep up with.
>
i know the feeling! i recently joined a couple more lists with the
volume across all of them combined, i'm really starting to get myself
confused. but they all have such great posts!

> I believe I saw info here (or on another homeschooling list?) about
> a way to exchange postcards with other home/un schoolers across the
> world. It sounded like a great way to learn a bit of geography,
> etc. Does anyone have the info? I can't get organized enough to
> try to sort through all of my old email.

i saw something like this on onelist but i think it was just for
the states in the U.S. not the world. it popped up when i did a
keyword search on the main onelist site for "montana" cuz it was one
of the states listed in the exchange. i remembered the list because
i thought it was such a neat idea for a geography project for a
homeschooler. not sure if this is what you
were looking for but you might try a keyword search for "post card".
might turn up all sorts of interesting lists!
>
> Thanks for your help! My 8 yr old son has decided he really wants
> to send the postcards! Debbie
>

Michele Moss
Mom of Sterling Tyler age 3 yrs old
Parents of Spirited Kids Resource Web site:
http://www.icstech.net/~michele
Parents of Spirited Kids Discussion Group:
http://www.egroups.com/list/psk

messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 145
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 08/13/1999 12:37:05 PM Eastern Daylight Time, Lborowiec@aol.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 08/13/1999 12:37:05 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
Lborowiec@... writes:

<<
I believe I saw info here (or on another homeschooling list?) about a way to
exchange postcards with other home/un schoolers across the world. It
sounded
like a great way to learn a bit of geography, etc. Does anyone have the
info? I can't get organized enough to try to sort through all of my old
email.

>>
We used to be part of the Postcard Exchange. The woman who organized this was
DarlaMom@.... I don't know if it's still going.
Debra

messages.subject: Digest Number 145
messages.msgSnippet: Hi!  I ve been lurking for several weeks now.  Receiving all these messages is new to me, and a bit difficult to keep up with. I believe I saw info here (or on
messages.messageBody:
Hi! I've been lurking for several weeks now. Receiving all these messages
is new to me, and a bit difficult to keep up with.

I believe I saw info here (or on another homeschooling list?) about a way to
exchange postcards with other home/un schoolers across the world. It sounded
like a great way to learn a bit of geography, etc. Does anyone have the
info? I can't get organized enough to try to sort through all of my old
email.

Thanks for your help! My 8 yr old son has decided he really wants to send
the postcards!
Debbie
